Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Pectoralis major Clavicle (medial half)
Sternum
Costal cartilages 1-6
Rectus sheath (anterior layer)		 Humerus (crest of greater tubercle) Lateral pectoral n.
Medial pectoral n.
C5 - T1		 Entire muscle: Adduction, IR
Clavicular & Sternocostal parts: Flexion, Aids in respiration when shoulder is fixed
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} - Clavicular part: [Clavicle (medial half)]({{< var ref-clavicle-bone.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - Sternocostal part: [sternum]({{< var ref-sternum-bone.path >}}), [costal cartilages 1â€“6]({{< var ref-costal-cartilages.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - Abdominal part: [rectus sheath (anterior layer)]({{< var ref-rectus-sheath.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ::: {.callout-note} Manubrium and the aponeurosis of the external oblique are potential originations of the pectoralis major ::: # Insertion {#insertion} [Humerus (crest of greater tubercle)]({{< var ref-humerus-bone.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Innervation {#innervation} - [Lateral pectoral nerve]({{< var ref-lateral-pectoral-nerve.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - [Medial pectoral nerve]({{< var ref-medial-pectoral-nerve.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - ([C5]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c5 >}}), [C6]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c6 >}}), [C7]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c7 >}}), [C8]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c8 >}}), [T1]({{< var ref-nerve-root.t1 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} - **Entire muscle**: GHJ Adduction, Internal rotation @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - **Clavicular and sternocostal parts**: Flexion; assist in respiration when shoulder is fixed @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 **Entire muscle**: GHJ Adduction, Internal rotation

**Clavicular and sternocostal parts**: Flexion; assist in respiration when shoulder is fixed # Length test - PEctoralis major contracture test (hands behind head) # Muscle-to-tendon Surgery - Worse prognosis than [tendon-to-bone](#tendon-to-bone-surgery) because of slow healing # Tendon-to-bone Surgery {#tendon-to-bone} considerations - Thoracic spine mobility - Grip strength - light cardio - contralateral limb training (go light just to be safe to avoid irradiation) Exercises - Elbow CARs - Spine CARs -
